item.title: Report E-2025010104
item.description:
Report E-2025010104

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWK experienced an over the road release of UN2693 VOxOUT 70C from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 60-gallons of product released to a 20’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor and a 30’ x 3’ area of the asphalt road below. The tote was damaged due to not being strapped down which caused it to load shift into the trailer wall. The material left in the damaged tote was transferred into a new one for shipment on. The impacted areas were then cleaned with absorbents and degreaser. All the impacted snow, absorbents, and debris were containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged tote was cut up and placed into a cubic yard box. The waste was removed from the site for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025010383
item.description:
Report X-2025010383

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-02
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP AND DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER USED THE DECSION TREE WHICH LED TO THE CORRSOIVE RESPONSE PAGE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE GUIDLINES TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS DISPOSED OF.

item.title: Report E-2025010016
item.description:
Report E-2025010016

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one tenth (.1) of a gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal can due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
